section.audio_text: The VSD presents a profile view of the airplane and its environment to provide the pilot vertical situational awareness, and display other useful information. When the VSD is selected, the Navigation Display will show a set of cyan dashed lines 1x RNP to each side of the airplane’s current track.

The area between the lines is referred to as the “swath” and indicates the area mapped by the VSD. As the airplane turns, the swath will expand angularly in the direction of the turn to include a preview of the waypoints and highest terrain in the swath. Note: The VSD is intended as an awareness tool and not intended to be a control instrument like the PFD.
